S31640-021_syn_2:
HISTORY: Ms. [REDACTED] presented with recurrent pneumonia secondary to a typical carcinoid tumor within the right middle lobe bronchus.
PROCEDURE: The airway was accessed via flexible bronchoscopy under moderate sedation. The target lesion, a vascular mass occluding 70% of the RML orifice, was id[REDACTED]. Mechanical excision was pursued utilizing a combination of electrocautery-independent snare resection and forceps debulking. No thermal ablation modalities were employed. Hemostasis was achieved via cold saline lavage.
IMPRESSION: Successful mechanical debulking of RML endobronchial tumor.
S31640-021_syn_3:
Service: Bronchoscopy with tumor excision (CPT 31640).
Method: Mechanical debulking only.
Tools: Polypectomy Snare, Biopsy Forceps.
Target: Right Middle Lobe (RML) bronchus.
Details: Visualized obstructing mass. Used snare to resect bulk of tumor. Residual tissue removed with forceps. No laser or APC used. Hemostasis maintained with saline.
Justification: Removal of obstructing tumor to restore airway patency.

S31640-021_syn_9:
Indication: Endobronchial typical carcinoid in right middle lobe bronchus triggering recurrent pneumonia.

Interventions: Snare cutting and forceps removal were utilized to physically excise and debulk the growth. No thermal destruction performed.
